DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Processing Paraffin Saturation Comments Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Comments made in regard to paraffin embedding of the FFPE tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Cleaning and preparation of tissues for further use in biological products._A common name for a group of high molecular weight alkane hydrocarbons with the general formula CnH2n+2, where n is between 22 and 27. Paraffin is also a technical name for an alkane in general, but in most cases it refers specifically to a linear, or normal alkane. It is mostly found as a white, odorless, tasteless, waxy solid, with a melting point between 47C and 65C. It is insoluble in water, but soluble in ether, benzene, and certain esters. Paraffin is unaffected by most common chemical reagents but oxidizes readily._Impregnation of one substance by another to the greatest possible extent; that concentration of a dissolved substance that cannot be exceeded.._A written explanation, observation or criticism added to textual material.

Paraffin is also a technical name for an alkane in general, but in most cases it refers specifically to a linear, or normal alkane. It is mostly found as a white, odorless, tasteless, waxy solid, with a melting point between 47C and 65C. It is insoluble in water, but soluble in ether, benzene, and certain esters. Concepts.definition: A common name for a group of high molecular weight alkane hydrocarbons with the general formula CnH2n+2, where n is between 22 and 27. Paraffin is also a technical name for an alkane in general, but in most cases it refers specifically to a linear, or normal alkane. It is mostly found as a white, odorless, tasteless, waxy solid, with a melting point between 47C and 65C. It is insoluble in water, but soluble in ether, benzene, and certain esters. Paraffin is unaffected by most common chemical reagents but oxidizes readily.
Impregnation of one substance by another to the greatest possible extent; that concentration of a dissolved substance that cannot be exceeded.
A written explanation, observation or criticism added to textual material.
